e4: Switching to an unbiased reporting policy enhances corporate transparency and integrity, aligning with ethical standards and reducing legal risks. Although the transition may initially confuse some investors, clear and effective communication can mitigate this concern over time. The change promotes long-term trust and confidence in the company, benefiting all stakeholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, accurate, and free from intentional bias or manipulation. It should consistently provide true, fair, and complete financial information, enabling investors to make informed decisions. Considerations include the impact on all stakeholders, legal compliance, and fostering long-term trust. Ethical policies also embrace strong internal controls and open communication.
e6: What strategies and communication plans are in place to ensure investors understand the change from biased to unbiased reporting? How will the transition impact investor relations, and what measures will be implemented to support retail investors? What potential legal implications are we prepared for if the policy change isn't well-received?
